      # Welcome!

Welcome to your Digital Postcard Project 🖖🧑‍💻

## 💬 Fundamentals:

We have prepared a series of exercises where you will practice everything you have learned so far about HTML and CSS.

1. Create a basic `HTML` structure.

2. Use previously seen tags from scratch.

3. Connect stylesheets.

4. Apply different styles with `CSS` to spice up your project.

5. Manage `<divs>`.

## Useful Readings:

+ [https://www.w3schools.com/TAgs/default.asp](https://www.w3schools.com/TAgs/default.asp)

+ [https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_css.asp](https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_css.asp)

Based on the CSS rule you've shared for the `.button` class, it looks like you've set the `font-family` to `Handlee`. However, the HTML snippet you provided earlier does not show the `button` element with the `.button` class applied to it. To apply the styles you've defined for the `.button` class, you need to add the class to your `button` element in the HTML like this: ```html
``` Can you try adding the `class="button"` to your `button` element and see if that resolves the issue with the font not being applied?

ai_interactions.ai_response:
It seems like you're having trouble with the `font-family` property not being applied to your postcard. Let's check a few things:

- Have you made sure that the `font-family` property is correctly spelled and the syntax is correct with a semicolon at the end? It should look like this: `font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Tahoma, sans-serif;`
- Is the `.postcard` class correctly applied to the HTML element that you want to style with this font?
- Could there be any other CSS rules that are overriding the `font-family` for the `.postcard` class? Look for any other styles that might be affecting the same elements.

Can you review these points and let me know what you find? If everything seems correct, could you also provide the HTML code where the `.postcard` class is used, so we can further investigate the issue?

This is the current exercise instructions: --- # `13` Check Your Postcard The last part will be our footer. What is the only element present in the footer? ![Postcard body content](../../assets/13.gif) ## 📝 Instructions: 1. Create a ` ``` 2. Apply `text-align: center;` rule to the `.postcard-footer` class, that style will help align all of the `
` content to the center (the button will be centered). ```css .postcard-footer { text-align: x; } ``` 3. Apply a darker `background` and a `padding` to the button. ```css button { background-color: x; padding: x; } ``` ---
ai_interactions.ai_response: Based on the instructions provided, have you added the `text-align: center;` rule to the `.postcard-footer` class in your CSS file? This will help center the button within the footer. Additionally, have you applied a darker background and padding to the button using the `background-color` and `padding` properties in your CSS? These styles will enhance the appearance of the button. Can you share your current CSS code for the `.postcard-footer` class and the `button` so we can take a closer look at what might be missing or needs adjustment?

ai_interactions.ai_response:
It sounds like you want to align the last input within the `.postcard-body` div to match the bottom of the first `

` element. Have you considered using CSS flexbox or grid properties to achieve this alignment? For example, you could set the `.postcard-body` to `display: flex;` and then use `align-items: flex-end;` to align the items to the bottom. Can you try implementing this and see if it helps you achieve the desired alignment?
